question: The principle of contrast states that a difference in form is always associated with a difference in meaning.
The SimLex-999 dataset gives values on a scale from 0 to 10 from near synonyms.
Word relatedness is also traditionally called word association in psychology.
Osgood and collaborators found that words vary along three important dimensions of affective meaning called valence, arousal, and dominance.
Synonyms have the same meaning in some or all contexts.
